results.definition: a deep bow with the foot drawn backwards (indicating excessive humility)

examples: The cat scraped at the armchair

results.definition: bend the knees and bow in a servile manner
a harsh noise made by scraping
examples: the scrape of violin bows distracted her

results.definition: an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
gather (money or other resources) together over time
examples: She had scraped together enough money for college

results.definition: bruise, cut, or injure the skin or the surface of
cut the surface of; wear away the surface of

examples: They scraped a letter into the stone
